sentence.Network_en: The duo set up a scam to settle their respective debts.
sentence.Network_cn: 那对搭档设了一计以消除各自的债务。

sentence.Network_en: The president persuaded the West to write off Polish debts.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统说通西方免除波兰的债务。

sentence.Network_en: His errant son at Dartmouth ran up debts of £250m.
sentence.Network_cn: 他那行为出格的儿子在达特茅斯欠下了高达2亿5千万英镑的债务。

entry.def: A debt is a sum of money that you owe someone.

example.ex: Three years later, he is still paying off his debts...
example.tran: 都3年了，他仍在偿还债务。

example.ex: Shrinking economies mean falling tax revenues and more government debt.
example.tran: 经济收缩意味着税收的减少和政府债务的增加。

entry.def: Debt is the state of owing money.

example.ex: Stress is a main reason for debt.
example.tran: 重压是负债的一个主要原因。

entry.tran: (表示感激）我欠你个人情/我受你的恩惠
entry.def: You use debt in expressions such as I owe you a debt or I am in your debt when you are expressing gratitude for something that someone has done for you.

example.ex: He was so good to me that I can never repay the debt I owe him...
example.tran: 他对我太好了，我永远也还不清这份人情。

example.ex: I owe a debt of thanks to Joyce Thompson, whose careful and able research was of great help...
example.tran: 我要衷心地感谢乔伊斯·汤普森先生，他严谨而卓著的研究给予了我极大的帮助。
